channel.title: Need help with scar 2.0.3.exe file on linux
channel.description: i need a little help here. i use linux, elive. i downloaded SCAR 2.0.3.exe and now i cant install SCAR, cause linux opens the .exe file in the Mplayer. i almost forgot to tell ya that i have linux on the virtual machine, not the real one. :P

item.title: Need help with scar 2.0.3.exe file on linux
item.dc:creator: @blackhat blackhat
item.description:
@blackhat wrote:

dude i run scar in linux, using Wine. u will find wine come with and distro these days

also if u cant use scar use a bot (not like aryan) but a scarable bot just mash your own togeather, shouldnt be to hard.

or try imp-softs scarble java bot (runs on linux)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I messed up while typing, I meant the last sentence to be:

However, a lot of programs don't work with it, and I would doubt SCAR will.

item.source: Need help with scar 2.0.3.exe file on linux

item.title: Need help with scar 2.0.3.exe file on linux
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Zach1188:

Similar to what jme said, Linux cannot execute .exe files. Most of the extensions you use in Windows (Besides .txt etc.) mean nothing to Linux. You may want to look into a program called WinE for Linux, it allows you to run Windows apps. However, a lot of programs don't work with it, and I would SCAR will.

I dont know if maybe this is new, but Im pretty sure Wine doesn't run SCAR.

Gnome/KDE seem to have more luck thogh, because my game will run on an emulator with those distro's.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with scar 2.0.3.exe file on linux
